result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas J.L. Defoe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  The Defendant is to complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to participate in a sobriety maintenance program.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  The Defendant is to cooperate with the Department of Corrections for transitional living.  Department is to do everything it can to assist in finding transitional housing.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

timeConds.notes: Defendant may complete up to 75 hours of community service and Court will grant $15/hour credit toward costs (total for all three cases).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: The Defendant is to complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended.  The Defendant is to obtain a GED/HSED or equivalent.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  If the AODA assessment was already completed through VIOS, then does not need to be duplicated.  The Defendant is to complete Mental Health treatment and take prescribed drugs.  The Defendant is to complete an AA program or other alcohol treatment program.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
